pullRequest.body:
The new notations (with `open scoped RightActions`) are:

* `r •> m` as an alias for `r • m`
* `m <• r` as an alias for `MulOpposite.op r • m`
* `r +ᵥ> m` as an alias for `r +ᵥ m`
* `m <+ᵥ r` as an alias for `AddOpposite.op r +ᵥ m`

An alternative proposal was to use variants of `•` with arrows inside:
* `r ⮊ m` as an alias for `r • m`
* `m ⮈ r` as an alias for `MulOpposite.op r • m`

but this doesn't have an obvious additive counterpart, and apparently has font issues.

Zulip messages:

* ["And `m <• r` would be notation for `(to_opposite r) • m`, or something like that?"](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/left.20vs.20right.20modules.20in.20tensor.20products/near/262063344)
* ["I rather like the idea of having a new piece of notation for right actions"](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Noncommutative.20ring.20things/near/390011490)
* [I like your proposed notation `<•` for the right scalar action. Maybe we should even introduce `•>` as an alias for `•`](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/ideals.20in.20non-comm.20rings/near/252156362)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Your alternative proposal doesn't display on my MacBook (Firefox and Edge). Apparently they are https://codepoints.net/U+2B88 and https://codepoints.net/U+2B8A which doesn't look very suitable to me. I like ⟳ and ⟲ but they look very tiny in VSCode ... `r •⟳ m`, `m ⟲• r`

> Actually, maybe you could add the `b <• a₃ <• a₄ = b <• (a₃ * a₄)` lemma in this PR?

Done, I agree this is a good idea.

> which doesn't look very suitable to me.

I choose them because they look like the previous smul symbol, but with an arrow inside.
The fact they don't render for you is indeed a good argument for not using them!

> Actually, maybe you could add the `b <• a₃ <• a₄ = b <• (a₃ * a₄)` lemma in this PR?

This is a good lemma to have because we already have [`rightCoset_assoc`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/Coset.html#rightCoset_assoc) as a special case when `a₃ a₄ : α`, `b : Set α`.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7338673421/job/19981557100)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7338673421/job/19981556821)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7338673421/job/19981556959)
Thanks! LGTM. But I have no idea about precedences. The effect looks good though.
Thanks! LGTM. But I have no idea about precedences. The effect looks good though.

I like the careful thought applied to precedence levels so that `a₁ •> a₂ •> b <• a₃ <• a₄` is just a few rewrites away from `(a₁ * a₂) •> b <• (a₃ * a₄)`.

It's a bit of a shame that one of the intermediate rewrites would be `(op a₄ * op a₃) •> (a₁ * a₂) •> b`, but I don't see a way to avoid that without maybe more `@[to_additive]`-style metaprogramming... I assume there will be some reassociation lemmas just for right actions to avoid intermediate steps with visible `op`s and side-flipping. Actually, maybe you could add the `b <• a₃ <• a₄ = b <• (a₃ * a₄)` lemma in this PR?
@kmill, can you check this looks sensible?
Yes, I think so, and I think this must have been an oversight on my part since I was under the impression that delaborators were scoped if the notation was.
Split to #8934, since I think this fix is more pressing than the notation which might go through more bikeshedding.

```suggestion
-- association is chosen to match multiplication and addition
```

```suggestion
scoped notation3:74 r:75 " +ᵥ> " m:74 => r +ᵥ m
```
(just style, not a functional change)
This one _is_ functional, isn't it? It removes an unwanted space from the pretty-printed output?
I'm pretty sure that the pretty printer only uses that there is a space as a hint to insert a single space.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(GroupTheory/GroupAction/Opposite): add notation for right and left actions

nodes.body: Thanks! LGTM. But I have no idea about precedences. The effect looks good though.

I like the careful thought applied to precedence levels so that `a₁ •> a₂ •> b <• a₃ <• a₄` is just a few rewrites away from `(a₁ * a₂) •> b <• (a₃ * a₄)`.

It's a bit of a shame that one of the intermediate rewrites would be `(op a₄ * op a₃) •> (a₁ * a₂) •> b`, but I don't see a way to avoid that without maybe more `@[to_additive]`-style metaprogramming... I assume there will be some reassociation lemmas just for right actions to avoid intermediate steps with visible `op`s and side-flipping. Actually, maybe you could add the `b <• a₃ <• a₄ = b <• (a₃ * a₄)` lemma in this PR?

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: `scoped notation3` should create scoped delaborators
